headline: General Motors CEO on the State of the Auto Industry
summary: At WSJ’s Future of Everything event, Mary Barra speaks with WSJ editor in chief Emma Tucker about how her company is navigating a changing sector, including shifting consumer demands, China’s rapid EV advancement and tariffs.

headline: General Motors CEO Defends Trump Auto Tariffs
summary: Mary Barra, in an interview with WSJ’s Emma Tucker at the Future of Everything event, says she speaks regularly with the White House and that tariffs help them compete with international auto companies.  General Motors  CEO  Mary Barra  on Wednesday voiced support for President Trump’s tariffs, saying U.S. automakers face unfair disadvantages in the global marketplace.  In an interview at The Wall Street Journal’s Future of Everything event, Barra said foreign government subsidies and taxes put American car brands at a disadvantage—a belief long shared by Detroit automakers and Trump.

In an interview at The Wall Street Journal’s Future of Everything event, Barra said foreign government subsidies and taxes put American car brands at a disadvantage—a belief long shared by Detroit automakers and Trump.

headline: Watch: GM’s Mary Barra Talks Tariffs, China Threats
summary: General Motors Chief Executive Mary Barra says she envisions an “all electric” future. But the automaker must adapt its electric-vehicle strategy to meet new consumer and regulatory demands, when the company is also facing billions in tariff costs.

raw.headline: Watch: GM’s Mary Barra Talks Tariffs, China Threats
raw.summary: General Motors Chief Executive Mary Barra says she envisions an “all electric” future. But the automaker must adapt its electric-vehicle strategy to meet new consumer and regulatory demands, when the company is also facing billions in tariff costs.

headline: From Autos to Pharma, CEOs Navigate Tariff Impacts
summary: General Motors Chief Executive  Mary Barra  said she speaks with the White House regularly, and that tariffs could help U.S. automakers compete with international companies.  In an interview with Editor in Chief Emma Tucker at WSJ’s annual Future of Everything event Wednesday, Barra said that GM — which is facing billions in new tariff costs — is aiming to mitigate the impact on consumers.

raw.headline: From Autos to Pharma, CEOs Navigate Tariff Impacts

In an interview with Editor in Chief Emma Tucker at WSJ’s annual Future of Everything event Wednesday, Barra said that GM — which is facing billions in new tariff costs — is aiming to mitigate the impact on consumers.

raw.summary: Investment supports production of GM’s V8 engines, used in full-size trucks and SUVs.

headline: GM’s Mary Barra on the Auto Giant’s EV Strategy
summary: General Motors Chief Executive  Mary Barra  says she envisions an “all electric” future, but the company now has to adapt its EV strategy to meet new consumer and regulatory demands, at a time when it’s also facing billions in tariff costs.  Barra will sit down with WSJ Editor in Chief  Emma Tucker  on Wednesday as part of WSJ’s annual Future of Everything event.  Earlier this week, GM said it’s pulling its plan to invest in electric-vehicle production at its upstate New York plant and will instead allocate $888 million to set it up for making the newest V-8 engines.

raw.headline: GM’s Mary Barra on the Auto Giant’s EV Strategy
raw.summary: General Motors Chief Executive  Mary Barra  says she envisions an “all electric” future, but the company now has to adapt its EV strategy to meet new consumer and regulatory demands, at a time when it’s also facing billions in tariff costs.  Barra will sit down with WSJ Editor in Chief  Emma Tucker  on Wednesday as part of WSJ’s annual Future of Everything event.  Earlier this week, GM said it’s pulling its plan to invest in electric-vehicle production at its upstate New York plant and will instead allocate $888 million to set it up for making the newest V-8 engines.

headline: GM to invest $888M in New York to produce next-gen V8 engine
summary: The automaker will use the funds to install new machinery, equipment, tools and facility renovations at its Tonawanda Propulsion plant.
